Package javelin.controller.quality

Class Quality

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.controller.quality.Quality
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Baatezu, Constrict, Construct, CriticalImmunity, DamageReduction, Elemental, EnergyImmunity, EnergyResistance, FastHealing, FrightfulPresence, ImprovedGrab, MindImmunity, NoHealing, Ooze, ParalysisImmunity, Perception, Poison, PoisonImmunity, SpellImmunity, SpellResistance, Subtype, SunlightVulnerability, Undead, Vision
    public abstract class Quality
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Monster's special attack or special ability. Note that not at specialties are implemented as a Quality. For example Monster.breaths. TODO make Quality a subclass of Upgrade as well? For example: MindImmunity is not being offered as upgrade.

                         Monster m)

      • has

        public abstract boolean has​(Monster m)
        This is used only in order to decide if uses rate(Monster) or not.
        Returns:
        true if given Monster has this quality.
        See Also:
        #apply(String)

      • rate

        public abstract float rate​(Monster m)
        Returns:
        Challenge rating factor fot the given Monster.

      • describe

        public java.lang.String describe​(Monster m)
        Returns:
        A description of this Monsters ability if it's one he has(Monster). May return null in order to be ignored.

      • apply

        public boolean apply​(java.lang.String text,
                     Monster m)
        This is used only in order to decide if uses #add(Monster) or not.
        Parameters:
        monster - Monster being examined. Note that this entry is still being read by MonsterReader and could be incomplete.
        Returns:
        true if given lowercase String is describing this quality.
        See Also:
        has(Monster)
